title: Expose binary parsing in the API
body: Fixes #199

title: Overwrite test outputs with a `--bless` option
body: I prefer this to the previous way which involved setting an environment variable. An env variable felt a bit clunky. I sadly can't get `--bless` to appear in the `--help` message without copying all of `libtest_mimic`'s argument parsing. Not worth it.

title: Centralize test exclusion into a single function
body: This makes it easier to follow which tests are yet to be fixed and which will never pass.

title: Allow mutation in normalization
body:
This is a followup to #193, which would have been a natural candidate for mutation if the code allowed it. Now it does! We can now mutate a `Nir`, which will transparently clone the underlying `NirKind` if needed. In most cases however I expect that no cloning will be necessary, so this should be good for perfs.
I wish we had benchmarks to check that, but that's a lot more effort.

title: CI: Use a workaround to not hit the clippy issue
Implement With with no desugar
body:
Part of #180 

This would have probably been simpler to implement with recursion, but I got there in the end :sweat_smile:

title: Rework import caching and resolution
body:
The import resolution and caching code was quite complicated: higher-level functions when not really needed, unidiomatic error handling, bad separation of concerns.
This loses many unit tests, but imho it's worth it because the new code is so much clearer than the old code+unit tests. Might add some back as needed one day.

title: Allow `Text/replace ` to support an abstract haystack
body: … as standardized in dhall-lang/dhall-lang#1096

title: Implement serialization
body: Fixes https://github.com/Nadrieril/dhall-rust/issues/164

title: Use u64/i64 instead of usize/isize for the main number types
body: `usize` is for control/indexing numbers; `u64` is for data numbers.

title: Make `SimpleValue` deserializable within other types
body: Fixes https://github.com/Nadrieril/dhall-rust/issues/184

title: Make SimpleValue public and add from_simple_value()
body: Fixes https://github.com/Nadrieril/dhall-rust/issues/177.

title: Implement Text/replace

labels.name: standard-compliance
labels.description: Something doesn't work according to the dhall standard

body:
This PR implements the new built-in `Text/replace` which is part of standard v19.0 (tracking issue #180) 

There is one test that currently fails. I believe it is an issue with the way the standard is currently specified around text replacement with Text that isn't fully evaluated. My understanding is that this specific case should get fixed in a future revision of the standard https://github.com/dhall-lang/dhall-lang/pull/1065

Should I disable this `Text/replace` failing test? What about tests for other v19.0 features (`with` built-in), should I temporarily disable them until they get implemented?

title: Make reqwest an optional dependency
body:
This adds a feature to the Cargo.toml to be able to control if dhall depends on reqwest.
This makes it possible to build dhall-rust for any arch (not just wasm32) without depending on reqwest.

To disable reqwest as a dependency, we can now use `default-features = false` when adding the dhall dependency.

Closes #169

title: Update standard to v18
body: Closes #175

title: Use a custom test harness instead of generating tests in `build.rs`
body: This removes the need to rebuild when we add/remove tests, improves test detection and should improve compile times slightly too. This also makes test work on Windows, as they previously failed because of path idiosyncracies.

title: Make dhall-rust build on Windows
body: Discovered in https://github.com/Nadrieril/dhall-rust/issues/166 that it didn't.

title: Make dhall-rust compatible with wasm
body: Fixes https://github.com/Nadrieril/dhall-rust/issues/166

title: Draft add cache to resolve
body:
Add cache to resolve as defined in [standard](https://github.com/dhall-lang/dhall-lang/blob/master/standard/imports.md)

Create a `Cache` that check env vars depending on os and create folder if needed.
On `resolve_one_import` it search in the cache folder if the import `hash` is available if cache and hash are available.
If it exist then resolve and noramlize it. Check that the hash from the cache match the requested cache, if not delete the file from the cache
If cache is missing or invalid load te import like before and try to save it if a hash for import is provided.

Todo :
 - [x] Error management
 - [x] Tests
 - [x] Cache concurrency write (delegated to file API)
 - [x] Validate SHA of loaded from cache (if not delete cache file and load normally)
 - [x] ~Print info as defined in standard~ Didn't find how to send warn during compilation and feel out of scope for this PR
 - [x] Unit test on cache

Rel: #135

title: Move to v15 of the standard
Deserialize `Prelude.Map` and `toMap` to a map instead of a list
Factor out operations
body: This factors out everything related to operations (like function application or `+`) into its own module, which makes everything a bit clearer.

title: Implement semantic hashing (but no caching yet)
body: Step towards #135

title: Fix #155
body:
The code in span.rs had forgotten about the possibility of a span going to the end of the input string.

Fixes #155

title: Rewrite serde_dhall API
body:
This documents all the items, provides way more control over Dhall evaluation, and ensures none of the `dhall` crate leaks through.
Also massive breaking change.

Closes #82. Closes #80.

title: Include printer output in tests
body: To prevent regressions. I also fixed some redundant parens.

title: Parse RFC3986 URLs
body: Fixes https://github.com/Nadrieril/dhall-rust/issues/136

title: Update to latest pest_consume to remove spurious clippy warning
Setup CI to test with various toolchains
Implement record puns
body:
This is a draft; I'm waiting for the corresponding dhall-lang PR to get accepted.
EDIT: It's there https://github.com/dhall-lang/dhall-lang/pull/938
EDIT: It got accepted

title: Upstream local tests
body: See https://github.com/dhall-lang/dhall-lang/pull/933

title: Implement a bunch of missing features
body:
Closes #10 
Closes #123 
Implements most of the missing import features, plus some normalization tidbits.

title: Record projection by expression
body:
This PR implements the normalization part of #94
It looks to me like the type checking part of this feature is already implemented.

I don't think I fully understand when `PartialExpr` is needed, so I might have missed some cases that aren't covered by the test suite.

title: Catchup spec
body: Catchup to latest version of the dhall spec

title: Decouple main expression types
body:
Yet another massive refactor. This time, I decoupled typechecking from normalization: `Value` does not need to laboriously keep track of types anymore. Now we can normalize without typechecking if we want, though I don't know if that's a desirable property.
I also renamed intermediate expression types; now we have `Expr`, `Hir`, `Tir` (for typecheck) and `Nir` (for normalization).
This not only simplifies quite a few things, it also again makes the code easier to follow and amend. Name resolution is now done as part of the resolve phase, that previously only did import resolution. I should document all that at some point, but I'm having too much fun refactoring for now.

title: Improve the test harness
body: This removes _a lot_ of duplication from the test harness, and adds output tracking to all types of failure tests, so that we can track work on error messages (which currently suck)

title: Implement some missing features
body: Closes #96; did a bit of #123 and #94 too

title: Add basic pretty type errors to all errors
body: At least now type errors all point to a location in the source file. More work is needed to make them user-friendly though.

title: Enable multiple locations for type errors
body: Closes #116. The infrastructure is there, now we "just" need to write the messages ><

title: Rewrite normalization and typechecking with environments
body:
This is a long trial-and-error PR of madness, where I tried to incrementally remove all uses of `shift` and `subst_shift` and replace them with a cleaner system with environments and closures. I took a lot of ideas from `dhall-haskell` in the process. This removes a ton of magic and unpredictability.
Previously for example, an expression bound by a let could be recomputed many times if it was used under a lambda.
I've also reorganized the file structure a bit while I was at it. I feel like this is a huge gain in understandability and clarity.

title: Improve API
body: Clarifies the docs and supports many more types for deserialization

title: Seal `Deserialize` trait
body: Fixes #81

title: Merge a bunch of sub-crates
body:
The distinction between `dhall_syntax`/`dhall`/`dhall_generated_parser` doesn't really make sense anymore now that incremental compilation sucks less and that `dhall` stopped using custom procedural macros.
This is one of the last steps before I can publish on crates.io.

title: Parse projection by expression
body: Progress towards https://github.com/Nadrieril/dhall-rust/issues/94

title: Ground work for pretty type errors
body: We know have very basic pretty errors for a few type errors ! The output is also tested to ensure we don't break it.

title: Introduce Canonicalize
body:
Fixes #76 

Refactor of File to be the combination of Directory and the file name,where Directory is the Vector of component paths.

The refactor meant changing some sections of the code where we were
parsing and manipulating Files/Directories.

This also includes a new trait Canonicalization which is needed for
import logic.

This is just the introduction of the trait, but calling it needs to be added as well. From what I could see that's involved with import chaining, is that right? Do we have that yet?
